newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia RTS index closes at record 412.32.
newsitem.headline: Russia RTS index closes at record 412.32.

text.p: The Russian Trading System index of 22 leading shares closed at a record 412.32 on Tuesday, or 2.93 percent up on Monday's record 400.59 closing.
Total market turnover on Tuesday, the fifth record-setting trading session, was a robust $65.6 million.
"Everything is rising and I cannot see any signals of a fall," a Regent European Securities trader said. "This is not a speculative rise, but a rise on fundamentals."
LUKoil ordinaries were the gain-leaders with prices rising to $18.71 from $17.99 at Monday's close, slightly off a daily high of $19.15.
But some traders said the market was getting overheated and a small correction was possible despite falling liquidity.
"Practically all paper has reached new levels," said deputy head of ICFI Bank's securities department Alexei Abdurakhimov, adding prices would have to fall for new sales to begin.
"The market is so high because people have sold 90 percnet of what they had," he said.

Long distance carrier Rostelekom, which has languished on the stock market, partly over uncertainty over an auction of Svyazinvest telecoms holding company which controls Rostelekom, ticked up to $3.875 from $3.865.
Russia said this week the Svyazinvest auction would take place on July 25.
"Everyone is waiting for the Svyazinvest auction," the Regent European Securities trader said. "Foreigners see it as a sign of how much the Russian market is open for foreign investment."
